title: Northern Expressway: Truck carrying chicken catches fire
text:
Several chickens have been killed after the trailer they were in caught fire on the Northern Expressway this morning.

Citybound traffic is blocked, with motorists being diverted at the Angle Vale exit while emergency crews clear the scene.

The road was expected to reopen about 7.30am, but police were still diverting traffic at 8.30am.

Police say the blaze broke out in the rear trailer of a B-double truck about 4am while driving on the Northern Expressway in the Andrews Farm-Munno Para area.

The truck driver managed to detach the burning trailer from the prime-mover and was not injured.

Sadly, a number of chickens were killed in the fire and the rest will be euthanised.

The exact cause is still undetermined.

PEDESTRIAN HIT BY CAR IN HACKHAM

A pedestrian has been seriously injured after being hit by a car in Hackham.

The male pedestrian was struck just after 5.30am today and suffered serious leg and head injuries.

He was rushed to the Flinders Medical Centre but his injuries are not considered life-threatening at this stage.

The driver was taken to the Noarlunga Hospital for shock.

Main South Rd was closed for southbound traffic from Mick O'Sheas pub.
